# DocHelp
---
Your Go-to AI Helper For All Kind Of Documents

> Built mostly using JavaScript, DocHelp empowers you to write better documentations, summaries, and codes. It provides functionalities such as:
>  - markdown linting
>  - code linting
>  - prompt engineering
> - summarization 
> - translation 
> -  and many more

## Live Demo
[DocHelp](https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app/)

## Usage
Once you clone this repo, you can run this project locally by following these steps:
1. Clone the repo: `git clone https://github.com/Debam-007/DocHelp.git`
2. Change directory: `cd DocHelp`
3. Install dependencies: `npm install`
4. Start the project: `npm start`
5. Head to: [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000/)

## Contributing

Contributions are always welcome!

- Fork the repo
- Create your branch: `git checkout -b my-new-feature`
- Make your changes
- Commit your changes: `git commit -m "Add some feature"`
- Push to your branch: `git push origin my-new-feature`
- Create a new Pull Request

MIT

Title: DocHelp - Your Go-to AI Helper For All Kind Of Documents
Description: Your Go-to AI Helper For All Kind Of Documents, built mostly using JavaScript language.
Demo: [Live](https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app/ "DocHelp")

## Table of Contents
- [About](#about)
- [Features](#features)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Usage](#usage)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

## About
DocHelp is an AI-powered tool that helps you create, edit, and manage your documents. It's easy to use and can be accessed from any device with an internet connection.

## Features
- Create new documents from scratch or import existing ones
- Edit documents in real-time with multiple collaborators
- Add images, videos, and other media to your documents
- Share your documents with others and get feedback
- Track changes to your documents over time
- Export your documents to PDF, Word, or other formats

## Installation
To install DocHelp, simply create an account at [https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app](https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app) and log in.

## Usage
Once you're logged in, you can start using DocHelp to create and manage your documents. To create a new document, click on the "New Document" button. You can then enter a title and description for your document, and start adding content.

To edit an existing document, simply click on the "Edit" button. You can then make changes to the document's content, title, or description.

To share a document with others, click on the "Share" button. You can then enter the email addresses of the people you want to share the document with.

To export a document to PDF, Word, or other formats, click on the "Export" button. You can then select the format you want to export the document to.

## Contributing
We welcome contributions from the community. If you find a bug or have a feature request, please open an issue on GitHub.

## License
DocHelp is licensed under the MIT License.

## VeuScribe

### The Next-Gen Video Conferencing Platform with AI Transcribing Tools

VeuScribe is a video conferencing platform that offers a variety of features to make your meetings more productive. With VeuScribe, you can:

- **Join meetings with just a click.** No need to download or install any software.
- **Share your screen.** Present your slides, demos, or other content with ease.
- **Record meetings.** Capture your meetings for later playback or sharing.
- **Transcribe meetings.** VeuScribe's AI-powered transcription service will automatically generate a transcript of your meeting.
- **Search transcripts.** Find the information you need quickly and easily.
- **Export transcripts.** Share your transcripts with others or save them for your records.

VeuScribe is built using JavaScript and is hosted at https://veuscribe.vercel.app.

### Features

- **AI-powered transcription**
- **One-click meeting joining**
- **Screen sharing**
- **Meeting recording**
- **Transcript search**
- **Transcript export**

### Benefits

- **Increased productivity:** VeuScribe's AI-powered transcription service makes it easy to find the information you need from your meetings.
- **Saved time:** VeuScribe's one-click meeting joining and screen sharing features save you time and hassle.
- **Improved collaboration:** VeuScribe's transcript sharing and export features make it easy to collaborate with others on your meeting notes.

### Pricing

VeuScribe is free to use for up to 10 participants. For more participants, please contact us for pricing information.

### Getting Started

To get started with VeuScribe, simply visit our website at https://veuscribe.vercel.app and click on the "Join a Meeting" button. You will be prompted to enter your name and email address. Once you have entered this information, you will be able to join the meeting.

### Support

If you have any questions or need help using VeuScribe, please contact us at support@veuscribe.com.

# DocHelp

Your Go-to AI Helper For All Kind Of Documents, built mostly using JavaScript language.

## Live Demo
[DocHelp](https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app)

## Features

- **Write markdown with AI Assistant:** Helps developers write documentation with AI Assistant.
- **Generates documentation from code comments:** Pulls code comments and creates documentation from them.
- **Supports multiple programming languages:** Currently supports JavaScript, Typescript, Python, Java, and C++, with more to come.
- **Exports documentation in multiple formats:** Exports documentation in markdown, HTML, and PDF formats.
- **Integrates with GitHub and GitLab:** Supports auto-update of documentation when code changes.

## Getting Started

To use DocHelp, you can either visit the [website](https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app) or install the [CLI tool](https://www.npmjs.com/package/dochelp).

### Website

1. Visit the DocHelp website at https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app.
2. Click on the "Get Started" button.
3. Sign in with your GitHub or GitLab account.
4. Select the repository you want to generate documentation for.
5. Click on the "Generate Documentation" button.

### CLI tool

1. Install the DocHelp CLI tool with npm:

```
npm install dochelp -g
```

2. Sign in to DocHelp with your GitHub or GitLab account:

```
dochelp login
```

3. Select the repository you want to generate documentation for:

```
dochelp select-repo
```

4. Generate documentation:

```
dochelp generate
```

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Debam-007/DocHelp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) before submitting a pull request.

## License

DocHelp is licensed under the MIT License.

# VeuScribe

The next-gen video conferencing platform with AI transcribing tools built mostly using JavaScript.

## Features

* **Real-time transcription:** VeuScribe uses state-of-the-art AI to transcribe your video calls in real time. This makes it easy to follow along with the conversation, even if you're not a native speaker.
* **Interactive transcripts:** VeuScribe's transcripts are interactive, so you can easily jump to any point in the conversation. You can also search for keywords and phrases, making it easy to find the information you need.
* **Shareable transcripts:** VeuScribe makes it easy to share your transcripts with others. You can export them as text files or PDFs, or you can share them directly with other VeuScribe users.

## Benefits

* **Improved communication:** VeuScribe can help you to communicate more effectively with your team members and clients. By providing real-time transcriptions, VeuScribe makes it easier to follow along with conversations and to avoid misunderstandings.
* **Increased productivity:** VeuScribe can help you to be more productive by making it easier to find the information you need. With interactive transcripts, you can quickly search for keywords and phrases, and you can easily jump to any point in the conversation.
* **Reduced costs:** VeuScribe can help you to reduce costs by eliminating the need for transcription services. VeuScribe's AI-powered transcription is accurate and affordable, making it a great option for businesses of all sizes.

## How to use VeuScribe

To use VeuScribe, simply create an account and start a video call. VeuScribe will automatically transcribe your call in real time. You can then use the interactive transcripts to follow along with the conversation, search for keywords and phrases, and share your transcripts with others.

## Pricing

VeuScribe is available on a subscription basis. There are three different pricing plans to choose from, so you can find the plan that's right for your needs.

## Get started today

Sign up for a free trial of VeuScribe today and see how it can help you to improve your communication and productivity.

## Links

* [Website](https://veuscribe.vercel.app)
* [Documentation](https://docs.veuscribe.com)
* [Support](https://support.veuscribe.com)

# Camgle

A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language.

## Introduction

Camgle is a search engine that uses computer vision to identify objects in images and videos. This allows users to search for images and videos based on their content, rather than just their text descriptions.

## Features

* **Object recognition:** Camgle can identify over 1000 different objects in images and videos.
* **Image search:** Users can search for images based on their content, rather than just their text descriptions.
* **Video search:** Users can search for videos based on their content, rather than just their text descriptions.
* **Reverse image search:** Users can upload an image and find other images that are similar to it.
* **Object detection:** Camgle can detect objects in images and videos, and return their bounding boxes.
* **Object tracking:** Camgle can track objects in videos, and return their trajectories.

Camgle is available as a web service at [https://camgle.com](https://camgle.com). Users can upload images and videos to Camgle, and then search for similar images and videos based on their content.

# Camgle: A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines

Camgle is a novel search engine that uses computer vision to extract visual features from images and then uses these features to match images to text queries. This approach allows Camgle to find images that are relevant to a user's query even if the query does not contain any text that describes the image.

## Features

* **Image search:** Camgle can be used to search for images using text queries, even if the query does not contain any text that describes the image.
* **Visual features:** Camgle extracts a variety of visual features from images, including color, texture, shape, and composition. These features are then used to match images to text queries.
* **Relevance ranking:** Camgle uses a relevance ranking algorithm to sort images based on their relevance to a user's query. The ranking algorithm takes into account a variety of factors, including the similarity of the image's visual features to the query's visual features, the popularity of the image, and the freshness of the image.
* **C++ implementation:** Camgle is implemented in C++ for efficiency and scalability.

## How to Use Camgle

To use Camgle, simply enter a text query into the search bar and click the "Search" button. Camgle will then return a list of images that are relevant to your query.

## What is VeuScribe?

VeuScribe is a cloud-based video conferencing platform designed for streamlined communication and collaboration. It empowers teams and individuals with advanced features such as real-time AI transcription, meeting summarization, and customizable branding.

## Key Features

- **Real-time AI Transcription:** Transcribe your video calls in real-time, providing a searchable and shareable record of your meetings.
- **Meeting Summarization:** Generate concise summaries of your meetings, highlighting key points and action items.
- **Customizable Branding:** Tailor the platform to your brand with custom logos, colors, and domain names.
- **Screen Sharing and Annotation:** Share your screen and collaborate with participants using the integrated annotation tools.
- **Breakout Rooms:** Create private breakout rooms for focused discussions or smaller team collaborations.
- **Participant Management:** Manage participant roles, mute/unmute, and remove participants as needed.
- **Cloud Recording:** Record your meetings and store them securely in the cloud for easy access.

## Built With

- JavaScript (React, Redux)
- WebSockets
- Node.js (Express.js)
- MongoDB
- Google Cloud Speech-to-Text API

## Getting Started

Visit the project website at https://veuscribe.vercel.app to create an account and start using VeuScribe.

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please read the [contribution guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md) before submitting a pull request.

## License

VeuScribe is licensed under the MIT License. See the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.

# Camgle

A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language.

## Features

- Search images using camera
- Search products using camera
- Recognize text from images
- Translate text from images

## Getting Started

To get started with Camgle, you will need to install the following dependencies:

- OpenCV
- Tesseract OCR
- Google Cloud Vision API

Once you have installed the dependencies, you can clone the Camgle repository and build the project:

```
git clone https://github.com/DebamGhosh/Camgle.git
cd Camgle
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
```

Once the project has been built, you can run it by executing the following command:

```
./Camgle
```

## Usage

Camgle has a simple command-line interface. To use Camgle, simply type the following command:

```
./Camgle <command> <arguments>
```

For example, to search for images using your camera, you would type the following command:

```
./Camgle search-image
```

Camgle will then open your camera and allow you to take a picture. Once you have taken a picture, Camgle will search for images that are similar to the image you took.

## Contributing

Contributions to Camgle are welcome. To contribute to Camgle, please fork the repository and create a pull request.

## License

Camgle is licensed under the MIT License.

## Camgle

A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language.

### Getting Started

To get started with Camgle, you will need to:

1. Clone the repository to your local machine.
2. Install the necessary dependencies.
3. Build the project.
4. Run the project.

### Prerequisites

The following software is required to run Camgle:

* A C++ compiler
* CMake
* OpenCV
* Boost

### Installation

To install the dependencies, run the following commands:

```
sudo apt-get install build-essential cmake
sudo apt-get install libopencv-dev
sudo apt-get install libboost-all-dev
```

To build the project, run the following commands:

```
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
```

To run the project, run the following command:

```
./camgle
```

### Usage

Camgle is a command-line tool. To use Camgle, you will need to provide the path to an image file as an argument. For example, to search for images similar to the image in the file `image.jpg`, you would run the following command:

```
./camgle image.jpg
```

Camgle will then return a list of images that are similar to the image in the file `image.jpg`.

### Features

Camgle has the following features:

* **Image search:** Camgle can be used to search for images that are similar to a given image.
* **Object recognition:** Camgle can be used to recognize objects in images.
* **Face detection:** Camgle can be used to detect faces in images.
* **Scene classification:** Camgle can be used to classify scenes in images.

### Contributing

Contributions to Camgle are welcome. Please read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/deeeeebam/camgle-cpp/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) before submitting a pull request.

### License

Camgle is licensed under the MIT License.

# Camgle: A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines

This project presents a novel approach to search engines that leverages camera input to provide more intuitive and efficient search experiences. Built primarily in C++, Camgle seamlessly integrates with camera devices to empower users with a unique way to interact with search engines.

## Features

* **Camera-based search:** Capture images or videos of objects, landmarks, or text to initiate a search query.
* **Real-time results:** Get instant search results as you pan the camera, providing a dynamic and immersive search experience.
* **Object recognition:** Identify and search for specific objects within images using advanced computer vision algorithms.
* **Landmark identification:** Explore nearby landmarks and gather information about their history and significance.
* **Text recognition:** Extract text from images and use it to perform web searches or translate languages.

## Usage

To utilize Camgle, follow these simple steps:

1. Install the necessary dependencies (refer to the documentation).
2. Run the application and grant camera access permissions.
3. Point the camera at the desired object or scene.
4. Capture an image or video to initiate a search query.

## Development

Camgle is an open-source project and welcomes contributions from the community. Developers can contribute to the following aspects of the project:

* Core camera integration and image processing algorithms
* Object and landmark recognition models
* User interface and usability enhancements
* Documentation and tutorials

## License

Camgle is distributed under the MIT License. See the LICENSE file for more details.

# DocHelp

[DocHelp](https://dochelp-dp.vercel.app) is an AI-powered documentation assistant. It's a one-stop solution for creating, editing, sharing, and collaborating on any documents, accessible from any device with a modern web browser.

## Features

- Create new documents.
- Open and edit existing documents.
- Collaborate with others in real-time.
- Export documents to PDF, Word, and other formats.
- Share documents with others.
- Get help with writing, editing, and formatting.
- With more to come...

## Usage

### Creating a New Document

To create a new document, click on the "New Document" button in the top-left corner of the screen. This will create a new, blank document. You can then start typing your text.

### Opening an Existing Document

To open an existing document, click on the "Open" button in the top-left corner of the screen. This will open a file picker where you can select the document you want to open.

### Collaborating with Others

To collaborate with others on a document, click on the "Share" button in the top-right corner of the screen. This will open a dialog where you can enter the email addresses of the people you want to share the document with.

### Exporting a Document

To export a document, click on the "Export" button in the top-right corner of the screen. This will open a dialog where you can select the format you want to export the document to.

### Getting Help with Writing, Editing, and Formatting

DocHelp offers a variety of features to help you with your writing, editing, and formatting. These features include:

* A spell checker
* A grammar checker
* A style checker
* A variety of templates and themes to help you create beautiful documents quickly and easily.

## Technologies

- Built primarily using JavaScript.
- Modern UI Design using TailwindCSS, Styled Components, and Framer Motion.
- Firebase Firestore for project database.
- Firebase Authentication for user authentication.
- Vercel for deployment.

# Camgle

## Project Overview

Camgle is a camera oriented approach to search engines, built mostly using C++ language.

## Features

* Fast and accurate image search
* Object recognition
* Image-based browsing

## Getting Started

To get started with Camgle, you will need to:

1. Install the C++ compiler
2. Clone the Camgle repository
3. Build the Camgle project
4. Run the Camgle application

### 1. Install the C++ compiler

The C++ compiler can be downloaded from the official website.

### 2. Clone the Camgle repository

```
git clone https://github.com/username/Camgle.git
```

### 3. Build the Camgle project

```
cd Camgle
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
```

### 4. Run the Camgle application

```
./Camgle
```

## Usage

The Camgle application can be used to search for images by using a camera. To do this, simply point the camera at the object you want to search for and click the "Search" button.

Camgle will then return a list of images that are similar to the object you searched for.

## Contributing

Contributions to Camgle are welcome. Please read the CONTRIBUTING.md file for more information.

## License

Camgle is licensed under the MIT License.

## Camgle

### Overview
Camgle is a camera oriented approach to search engines, built mostly using C++.

### Features

* **Image-based search:** Search for images using your camera.
* **Object recognition:** Identify objects in images.
* **Text recognition:** Extract text from images.
* **QR code scanning:** Scan QR codes to access information.
* **Augmented reality:** Overlay digital information onto the real world.

### Getting Started

To get started with Camgle, you will need to:

1. Install the Camgle app from the [App Store](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/camgle/id1454275620) or [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.camgle.app).
2. Create a Camgle account.
3. Open the Camgle app and sign in.

Once you have signed in, you can start using Camgle to search for images, identify objects, extract text, scan QR codes, and overlay digital information onto the real world.

### Usage

To use Camgle, simply point your camera at the object or scene you want to search for. Camgle will then use its image recognition and text recognition algorithms to identify the object or scene and return relevant search results.

You can also use Camgle to scan QR codes. To do this, simply point your camera at the QR code and hold it steady. Camgle will then automatically scan the QR code and take you to the corresponding website or app.

To overlay digital information onto the real world, simply point your camera at the scene you want to overlay the information on. Camgle will then use its augmented reality technology to overlay the information onto the scene.

### Examples

Here are some examples of how you can use Camgle:

* **Search for images of a specific object:** Point your camera at the object and tap the search button. Camgle will then return a list of images of the object.
* **Identify an object:** Point your camera at the object and tap the object recognition button. Camgle will then identify the object and display its name and description.
* **Extract text from an image:** Point your camera at the image and tap the text recognition button. Camgle will then extract the text from the image and display it on the screen.
* **Scan a QR code:** Point your camera at the QR code and hold it steady. Camgle will then automatically scan the QR code and take you to the corresponding website or app.
* **Overlay digital information onto the real world:** Point your camera at the scene you want to overlay the information on and tap the augmented reality button. Camgle will then use its augmented reality technology to overlay the information onto the scene.

### Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/camgle/camgle/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) before submitting a pull request.

### License

Camgle is licensed under the [MIT License](https://github.com/camgle/camgle/blob/main/LICENSE).

# Camgle

A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language.

## Project Goals

* To develop a search engine that can accurately retrieve images and videos based on visual content.
* To explore the use of computer vision and machine learning techniques for image and video retrieval.
* To create a user-friendly interface that allows users to easily search for and access visual content.

## Project Overview

Camgle is a search engine that allows users to search for images and videos using a camera. The search engine uses computer vision and machine learning techniques to extract visual features from images and videos, and then uses these features to retrieve similar images and videos from a database.

Camgle is built using a variety of open source libraries, including OpenCV, TensorFlow, and Qt. The search engine is currently hosted at null.

## Usage

To use Camgle, simply point your camera at an image or video and click the "Search" button. Camgle will then retrieve a list of similar images and videos from its database.

You can also use Camgle to search for images and videos using keywords. To do this, simply enter your keywords into the search bar and click the "Search" button.

# Camgle

A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language.

## Getting Started

This project uses a modified version of OpenCV 4.5.5 and the Eigen library for linear algebra operations. To build the project, you will need to have these libraries installed on your system.

### Installation

1. Clone the repository to your local machine

```
git clone https://null
```

2. Install the required libraries

```
sudo apt-get install libopencv-dev libeigen3-dev
```

3. Build the project

```
make
```

## Usage

To use the project, simply run the following command:

```
./camgle
```

This will open a window that will allow you to take a picture of an object. The project will then use the image to search for similar objects online.

## Features

* **Object recognition:** The project can recognize a wide variety of objects, including people, animals, and objects from everyday life.
* **Image search:** The project can use the image of an object to search for similar objects online.
* **Camera support:** The project can use a webcam or a smartphone camera to take pictures of objects.

* **Closed captions:** VeuScribe can also be used to provide closed captions for video conferences. This can be useful for people who are deaf or hard of hearing, or for people who simply want to follow along with the conversation without having to listen to the audio.

## Camgle: A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines

Camgle is a novel approach to search engines that uses a camera to capture images of objects and then uses those images to search for similar objects online. This allows users to search for objects without having to type in keywords, which can be helpful for finding objects that are difficult to describe or for finding objects that you don't know the name of.

### Features

* **Image-based search:** Camgle allows users to search for objects by taking pictures of them. This is helpful for finding objects that are difficult to describe or for finding objects that you don't know the name of.
* **Real-time results:** Camgle provides real-time results as you move the camera around. This allows you to quickly and easily find the object you're looking for.
* **Accurate results:** Camgle uses a variety of computer vision techniques to ensure that the results it provides are accurate. This means that you can be confident that the objects you find are the ones you're looking for.

### How to Use Camgle

To use Camgle, simply point your camera at the object you want to search for and press the search button. Camgle will then capture an image of the object and use it to search for similar objects online. The results will be displayed in a list, and you can click on any of the results to learn more about the object.

### Built With

* C++
* OpenCV
* Google Cloud Vision API

# Camgle

**A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines**

**Hosted at:** null

## Description

This project explores a novel approach to search engines, utilizing a camera-oriented interface for image and object recognition. It is primarily implemented in C++ and leverages advanced computer vision techniques to provide users with a unique and intuitive way to search for information.

## Features

* **Image and Object Recognition:** The search engine can identify and understand images and objects captured by a camera. This allows users to search for items based on their visual appearance, rather than relying solely on text-based queries.
* **Real-Time Search:** The engine performs searches in real-time, providing instant results as the camera is pointed at different objects. This enables users to quickly find information about their surroundings or identify unfamiliar objects.
* **Multiple Search Modes:** The engine supports various search modes, including keyword search, image search, and object recognition. Users can switch between modes depending on their desired search criteria.
* **Cross-Platform Compatibility:** The search engine is designed to be compatible with various platforms, including desktops, laptops, and mobile devices. This allows users to access the engine from any device with a camera.

## Installation

To install and run Camgle, follow these steps:

1. Clone the project repository:

```
git clone null
```

2. Install the required dependencies:

```
sudo apt-get install build-essential cmake
```

3. Build the project:

```
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
```

4. Run the search engine:

```
./camgle
```

## Usage

Once Camgle is running, point your camera at the desired object or image. The engine will automatically recognize the object and display relevant search results. You can also use the keyboard to enter keyword queries or switch between search modes.

# Camgle: A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines

Camgle is a project that explores the use of cameras as a primary input for search engines. It is built mostly using the C++ programming language.

## Motivation

Traditional search engines rely on text-based queries, which can be limiting for users who are unable or prefer not to use text. Camgle aims to provide an alternative way to search for information using images and videos.

## Approach

Camgle uses a variety of computer vision and machine learning techniques to extract features from images and videos. These features are then used to index the data and perform search queries.

## Results

Camgle has shown promising results in early testing. It is able to accurately retrieve relevant images and videos for a variety of queries.

## Future Work

We plan to continue developing Camgle and exploring new ways to use cameras for search. We believe that Camgle has the potential to revolutionize the way we interact with search engines.

## Contributing

We welcome contributions from the community. Please see the [contributing guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md) for more information.

## License

Camgle is licensed under the MIT License.

**Camgle**

**A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines**

Camgle is an innovative project that combines computer vision and natural language processing to create a new way to search for information. With Camgle, you can simply point your camera at an object or scene, and it will return relevant search results.

Camgle is built on a foundation of computer vision algorithms that can identify and classify objects and scenes in real time. These algorithms are used to extract visual features from the input image, which are then used to generate a query for a search engine.

Once the query is generated, Camgle uses natural language processing to interpret the query and retrieve relevant search results. The search results are then displayed to the user in a visually appealing and easy-to-navigate format.

Camgle is a powerful new tool that can be used for a variety of tasks, including:

* **Product search:** Camgle can be used to find products online by simply pointing your camera at them.
* **Image search:** Camgle can be used to find images of objects or scenes by simply pointing your camera at them.
* **Landmark identification:** Camgle can be used to identify landmarks and buildings by simply pointing your camera at them.
* **Information search:** Camgle can be used to find information about objects or scenes by simply pointing your camera at them.

Camgle is still under development, but it has the potential to revolutionize the way we search for information.

**Technical details**

Camgle is written in C++ and uses a variety of open source libraries, including:

* OpenCV for computer vision
* TensorFlow for natural language processing
* Qt for the graphical user interface

Camgle is licensed under the GNU General Public License (GPL).

**Getting started**

To get started with Camgle, simply download the source code from the project website and compile it. Once Camgle is compiled, you can launch it and start using it to search for information.

# Camgle 

Camgle is a Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language. 

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

* C++ compiler
* OpenCV library
* CMake

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:

```shell
git clone https://github.com/null/Camgle.git
```

2. Create a build directory and enter it:

```shell
mkdir build && cd build
```

3. Configure CMake:

```shell
cmake ..
```

4. Build the project:

```shell
make
```

### Usage

To use Camgle, simply run the following command:

```shell
./Camgle <image_path>
```

where `<image_path>` is the path to the image you want to search for.

# Camgle
A Camera Oriented Approach to Search Engines, built mostly using C++ language.

## Features
- OpenCV integration for image processing
- Python bindings for easy integration with other projects
- Command-line interface for easy use

## Installation
```
pip install camgle
```

## Usage
```
import camgle

# Create a Camgle object
camgle = camgle.Camgle()

# Load an image
image = cv2.imread("image.jpg")

# Search for similar images
results = camgle.search(image)

# Print the results
for result in results:
    print(result)
```

## Features

* Chat with a lawyer-like chatbot that can answer your legal questions.
* Get help drafting legal documents, such as contracts, wills, and pleadings.
* Access a database of legal resources, including statutes, case law, and legal articles.

## How to Use

1. Visit the SamvidhanAI website at https://samvidhanai.onrender.com.
2. Click on the "Chat with a Lawyer" button to start chatting with the chatbot.
3. Type your question in the chat box and press Enter.
4. The chatbot will respond with an answer to your question.
5. If you need help drafting a legal document, click on the "Document Drafting" button.
6. Select the type of document you need to draft from the list of options.
7. Follow the instructions on the screen to provide the chatbot with the information it needs to draft the document.
8. Once the chatbot has finished drafting the document, you can download it as a PDF file.

# SamvidhanAI

**A Law Based AI Chatbot and Document Draft Support Utility**

## Description

SamvidhanAI is an innovative tool that leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to provide legal assistance and support. It is designed to empower users with a comprehensive suite of features that include:

- **AI-Powered Chatbot:** Engage in natural language conversations with our AI chatbot to get legal information, guidance, and answers to your questions.
- **Legal Clause Generator:** Generate customized legal clauses and agreements tailored to your specific needs.
- **Document Drafting Assistance:** Get assistance in drafting legal documents such as contracts, NDAs, and wills.
- **Legal Research and Analysis:** Access a vast knowledge base of legal resources and insights to inform your decisions.

## Features

- **User-Friendly Interface:** Intuitive and easy to navigate for both legal professionals and non-legal users.
- **Comprehensive Legal Knowledge:** Extensive database covering a wide range of legal topics and jurisdictions.
- **Customizable Chatbot:** Train the chatbot to adapt to your specific legal domain and language.
- **Secure and Private:** All data and interactions are encrypted to ensure confidentiality.

## How to Use

To start using SamvidhanAI, simply visit our website at https://samvidhanai.onrender.com. You can register for a free account or use the chatbot anonymously.

## Built With

- JavaScript
- GPT-3 Language Model
- PostgreSQL
